title: Shameless Type Scare Tactics Poster day. BOO!
content:

“Face up to it”… funny.

I tell you mister, you’re crazy. Probably.

Tovarich is kick ass! I haven't seen it before! It looks like the great-grandchild of Steile Futura, and a third cousin of Calcite. I just love it!

And I love the photo of you with your posters, too. That's a keeper.

"I tell you mister, you’re crazy. Probably."

What do you mean Probably? :-) I'm certifiable!

ChrisL

Tovarich is a typeface I did in 1992. It was the first type I ever did. I had lost the file until recently. I just fixed it up--it was a real mess! I also just added CE and Cyrillic. I will post it later to Critique.

ChrisL

Thanks Mili,

You chose wisely which part of the country to live in.

BTW, I just watched Verdi's Don Carlo with Marti Saliman as the Grand Inquisitor. He and Talvela are my favorite bassos. What is it about Finland to create these big resonant dramatic bass voices? Perhaps the long winters :-)

ChrisL

Chris, perhaps one of the typical Finnish body shapes has something to do with it, the one with shortish legs and long back. Add to that a bit of a tummy, and you'll get a wonderful base for the voice... and why not the winter, too.

Maybe I should move to Finland in Winter to see if my singing improves?  
:-)
